title: Justification with the Extreme Value Theorem

content.question: The function f is defined for all x in the closed interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">[</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>,</mo> <mo> </mo> <mi>b</mi> <mo stretchy="false">]</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B75@</annotation> </semantics> </math> If f does not attain a maximum value on <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">[</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>,</mo> <mo> </mo> <mi>b</mi> <mo stretchy="false">]</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B75@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, If f does not attain a maximum value on which of the following must be true?

choices.label: f is not continuous on <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">[</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>,</mo> <mo> </mo> <mi>b</mi> <mo stretchy="false">]</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B75@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

f is not bounded on <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">[</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>,</mo> <mo> </mo> <mi>b</mi> <mo stretchy="false">]</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B75@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

f does not attain a minimum value on <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">[</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>,</mo> <mo> </mo> <mi>b</mi> <mo stretchy="false">]</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B75@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

The graph of f has a vertical asymptote in the interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">[</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>,</mo> <mo> </mo> <mi>b</mi> <mo stretchy="false">]</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B75@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

The equation <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mn>0</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CE9@</annotation> </semantics> </math> does not have a solution in the interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">[</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>,</mo> <mo> </mo> <mi>b</mi> <mo stretchy="false">]</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B75@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

content.answer: f is not continuous on <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">[</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>,</mo> <mo> </mo> <mi>b</mi> <mo stretchy="false">]</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B75@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

topic.text: 5.2: Extreme Value Theorem, Global Versus Local Extrema, and Critical Points

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Provide reasons or rationales for solutions and conclusions.
